I allmänhet kommer dessa skrupelfria legosoldater inte att nå långt i branschen, utan de trängs undan av de mer hänsynslösa och listiga jävlarna i deras led som är beredda att göra vad som helst för att imponera på den hand som matar dem.

trait.name: Auto-Injector (1/Day)
entries: När legosoldaten har 0 träffpunkter får den automatiskt ett Tier 3 Med-serum och får {@dice 8d4 + 8} träffpunkter.

trait.name: Explosive (1/Day)
entries: Slå en {@dice d6} för att se vilken sprängkraft legosoldaten har. Om du får 1 eller 2 är det en nivå 3-fragmenteringsgranat. På en 3 eller 4 är det en Tier 3 flashbang. På en 5 är det en nivå 3 napalmgranat. På en 6 är det en rökgranat.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: Legosoldatens vapenattacker är magiska.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Legosoldaten gör tre vapenattacker.

action.name: Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} för att träffa, räckvidd 1,5 m, ett mål. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d6 + 6}) huggskada och 9 ({@damage 2d8}) giftskada.

action.name: Gatling Gun
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 10} för att träffa, räckvidd 100/400 fot, ett mål. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) genomträngande skada och 2 ({@damage 1d4}) brandskador. Det här vapnet har den automatiska egenskapen.

action.name: Under-Barrel Thumper
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 10} för att träffa, räckvidd 40/160 fot, ett mål. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d10 + 6}) genomträngande skada och 5 ({@damage 1d10}) åskskskada. Det här vapnet har egenskapen blast. Det här vapnet måste laddas om med en bonus.

reaction.name: Subdermal Plating (Recharges on a Short or Long Rest)
entries: När legosoldaten tar skada av en annan typ än psykisk skada kan den få motstånd mot skadetypen i 1 minut. Du kan inte använda den här förmågan igen förrän du avslutar en kort eller lång vila.

Det är inget personligt, ett jobb är bara ett jobb, även om det handlar om att skjuta ner mängder av olyckliga åskådare för att uppnå en företags agenda. Lönen är trots allt mycket bättre än vad du skulle tjäna som kontorist på en smutsig bensinstation.

{@bold Dog Eat Dog.} Naturligtvis har vissa legosoldater sin stolthet och vissa gränser som de inte vill överskrida. I allmänhet kommer dessa skrupelfria legosoldater inte att nå långt i branschen, utan de trängs undan av de mer hänsynslösa och listiga jävlarna i deras led som är beredda att göra vad som helst för att imponera på den hand som matar dem.

trait.name: Charge (1/Turn)
entries: Om hulk rör sig minst 6 meter rakt mot ett mål och sedan träffar det med en Smash-attack i samma vändning får målet 14 ({@damage 6d6}) extra slagskada. Målet måste lyckas med ett {@dc 22} räddningskast för styrka eller slås omkull {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Deceptively Strong
entries: Hulken kan använda sin bonusåtgärd för att minska sin storlek från Large till Medium, för att dölja sin extrema cybernetik och framstå som en mestadels normal humanoid, eller återgå till sin sanna form. Medan den är i sin Medium storlek form, ger hulk halva skadan med attacker som använder Styrka.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: Om hulk misslyckas med ett räddningskast kan den välja att lyckas istället.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: Hulken återfår 10 träffpunkter i början av sin tur.

trait.name: Rising Fury
entries: När hulk är under hälften av sina träffpunkter lägger den till {@dice 1d6} på attackkast och räddningskast.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Hulken gör tre vapenattacker.

action.name: Smash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} för att träffa, räckvidd 3 meter, ett mål. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d10 + 7}) blåslagningsskada. Vid en kritisk träff mot en varelse bryter den här attacken av varelsens arm eller ben (Hulks val) om den har någon. Om varelsens arm är bruten har den nackdel på vapenattackkast och förmågekontroller som använder den armen, och varelsen har inte nytta av att hålla sköldar i den brutna armen. Om varelsens ben är brutet är dess hastighet halverad. En varelses brutna lem kan återställas med den mindre restaureringsbesvärjelsen eller liknande magi, eller under loppet av 30 dagars vila.

action.name: Throw Object
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 14} för att träffa, räckvidd 200/800 fot, ett mål. {@h}16 ({@dice 2d8 + 7}) Blodförstöring. Den här attacken använder ett närliggande föremål, till exempel en bit betong eller bråte som slits från en byggnad som en del av den här attacken.

reaction.name: Nano-Hardening
entries: Hulkens hud hårdnar som svar på fysiska trauman. När hulk tar skada som är bludgeoning, piercing eller slashing kan den halvera skadan och få resistens mot dessa skadetyper fram till slutet av nästa tur. Alternativt, när hulk tar skada av syra, kyla, eld, blixtar eller åska kan den halvera skadan och få motståndskraft mot dessa skadetyper till slutet av nästa tur.

legendary.name: Crush
entries: Hulken gör en Smash-attack.

legendary.name: Throw
entries: Hulken gör en Throw Object-attack.

legendary.name: Leap
entries: Hulken hoppar upp till 15 meter.

Nanomaskinhulken är en av människan skapad monstrositet, en brutal konstruktion som består av lika delar biologi och nanoteknik. Genom varje blodkärl, organ och ben rinner en flod av mikroskopiska maskiner som är programmerade för att förstärka och stärka hulk. Varje aspekt av deras kropp är en organisk anordning som maskintillverkats till perfektion genom outtröttlig ansträngning.

{@bold Nano-Disguise.} Hulken kan få sina nanomaskiner att minska sin visuella närvaro tills hulkens nanokvaliteter är omöjliga att upptäcka. De kan försöka leva ett normalt liv eller ta en position i den lokala regeringen.

{@bold Manmade Monster.} En nanomaskinhulka kommer in i den här världen på två sätt: den byggs upp från grunden, eller så förvandlas den genom mardrömsliknande och smärtsamma kirurgiska processer. Organisationen som skapade dem har sedan den svåra uppgiften att försöka behålla kontrollen över deras skapelse.

trait.name: Half-Life
entries: Elementaren har fördel på attacker och räddningskast när den har mer än hälften av sina träffpunkter.

trait.name: Toxic Form
entries: Elementaren kan gå in i en fientlig varelses utrymme och stanna där. Den kan röra sig genom ett utrymme som är så smalt som 1 tum brett utan att klämma sig fast. Varje varelse som börjar sin tur i elementalens utrymme tar {@damage 3d6} strålningsskada. Elementaren avger starkt ljus i en radie på 20 fot och svagt ljus i ytterligare 20 fot. Ljuset är solljus.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Elementarvarelsen gör två sjuka beröringsattacker.

action.name: Sickening Touch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} för att träffa, räckvidd 1,5 m, ett mål. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) strålningsskada. Om en varelse träffas av båda de sjuka beröringsattackerna måste den lyckas med ett {@dc 15} Konstitutionssparandekast eller få en nivå av irradiated.

action.name: Noxious Glow {@recharge 5}
entries: Varje varelse inom 15 fot från elementaren måste göra ett {@dc 15} räddningskast för konstitutionen. Vid ett misslyckat räddningsförsök tar målet 36 ({@damage 8d8}) strålningsskador och får en nivå av irradiation. Vid ett lyckat räddningsförsök tar en varelse halva skadan och blir inte bestrålad.
Jorden! Eld! Vind! Vatten! Kärnvapen! Med era kombinerade krafter, vad?
Kärnelementarerna är ett märkligt gäng. På sitt hemplan talar de med varandra på ett språk som vagt påminner om geigerräknare, men som förmodligen är mer besläktat med morsekod.

{@bold Half-Life.} De lever i allmänhet mycket kortare tid och är mycket mer instabila än sina elementära kusiner, samt är mycket mindre säkra för kramar jämfört med alla utom eldelementar, men de kompenserar för det med sitt glödande uppträdande.

trait.name: Toxic Form
entries: Elementaren kan gå in i en fientlig varelses utrymme och stanna där. Den kan röra sig genom ett utrymme som är så smalt som 1 tum brett utan att klämma sig fast. Varje varelse som börjar sin tur i elementalens utrymme tar {@damage 1d6} strålningsskada. Elementaren avger starkt ljus i en radie på 10 fot och svagt ljus i ytterligare 10 fot. Ljuset är solljus.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Elementarvarelsen gör två sjuka beröringsattacker.

action.name: Sickening Touch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} för att träffa, räckvidd 1,5 m, ett mål. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) strålningsskada. Om en varelse träffas av båda attackerna med sjuklig beröring måste den lyckas med en
{@dc 13} räddningskast för konstitutionen eller få en nivå av bestrålad.

action.name: Noxious Glow {@recharge 5}
entries: Varje varelse inom 15 fot från elementaren måste göra ett {@dc 13} räddningskast för konstitutionen. Vid ett misslyckat räddningsförsök tar målet 18 ({@damage 4d8}) strålningsskada och får en nivå av irradiation. Vid ett lyckat räddningsförsök tar en varelse halva skadan och blir inte bestrålad.
Jorden! Eld! Vind! Vatten! Kärnvapen! Med era kombinerade krafter, vad?
Kärnelementarerna är ett märkligt gäng. På sitt hemplan talar de med varandra på ett språk som vagt påminner om geigerräknare, men som förmodligen är mer besläktat med morsekod.

{@bold Half-Life.} De lever i allmänhet mycket kortare tid och är mycket mer instabila än sina elementära kusiner, samt är mycket mindre säkra för kramar jämfört med alla utom eldelementar, men de kompenserar för det med sitt glödande uppträdande.

trait.name: Chain Reaction
entries: När isotopen har minskat till 0 träffpunkter exploderar den. Mål inom tre meter från isotopen måste lyckas med ett {@dc 12} Dexterity räddningskast, och tar 7 ({@damage 2d6}) strålningsskador vid ett misslyckat räddningskast, eller hälften så mycket skada vid ett lyckat räddningskast. Om en annan isotop finns i området reduceras den också till 0 träffpunkter och exploderar, vilket kan kedja till andra isotoper.
Skadan som orsakas av alla explosioner ökar med 3 ({@dice 1d6}) för varje ytterligare isotop som exploderar, men ett mål i området för mer än en explosion påverkas bara en gång.
Om till exempel 5 isotoper fastnar i varandras explosioner, tillsammans med en varelse som befinner sig i ett av explosionsområdena, riskerar varelsen att ta {@damage 6d6} strålningsskada.

trait.name: Bright Mote
entries: Isotopen avger starkt ljus i en radie av 5 fot och svagt ljus i ytterligare 5 fot. Ljuset är solljus.

action.name: Ionize
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} för att träffa, räckvidd 1,5 m, ett mål. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) strålningsskada och 2 ({@damage 1d4}) kraftskada.

Dessa förtjusande små vänner älskar att samlas nära de glödande ljusen, som malar till lågan. Försök dock att hålla dem på armlängds avstånd, eller åtminstone på avstånd från varandra, eftersom de kan skapa ganska förödande kedjereaktioner när de samlas i svärmar.

trait.name: Imposing Aura
entries: Andra varelser som chefen väljer och som börjar sin tur inom 30 fot från chefen har fördel på sin första attack under varje tur.

trait.name: Smooth Step
entries: Chefen kan utföra åtgärden "Disengage" som en bonusåtgärd.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Chefen kan använda sin skräckinjagande närvaro. Den gör sedan två vapenattacker.

action.name: Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} för att träffa, räckvidd 1,5 m, ett mål. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) snittskada.

action.name: Dual Magnums
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} för att träffa, räckvidd 70/280 fot, ett mål. {@h}22 ({@damage 4d8 + 4}) genomträngande skada. Den här attacken ger halva skadan om endast en enda revolver används.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Varje varelse av bossens val som befinner sig inom 120 fot från bossen och är medveten om den måste lyckas med ett {@dc 15} räddningsprov för visdom eller bli {@condition frightened} i 1 minut. En varelse kan upprepa räddningskastet i slutet av var och en av sina turer, och avslutar effekten på sig själv vid en framgång. Om en varelses räddningskast lyckas eller om effekten upphör för den är varelsen immun mot bossens Frightful Presence de kommande 24 timmarna.

reaction.name: Vigilant Underlings
entries: När en varelse som chefen kan se riktar en attack mot honom kan chefen låta en villig varelse som han kan se använda sin reaktion för att röra sig upp till halva sin hastighet. Om varelsens rörelse slutar inom 5 fot från chefen riktar attacken sig mot varelsen istället.

Brottsbossen förtjänade sin position genom att hänsynslöst klättra sig upp till toppen av ett berg av rivalernas kroppar, och genom att förtjäna lojaliteten hos varje underordnad under deras befäl. Brottsbossen kan vara chef för sin egen grupp eller bara regional chef för ett världsomspännande syndikat.

trait.name: Smooth Step
entries: Maffian kan utföra åtgärden "Disengage" som en bonusåtgärd.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Mobstern gör två vapenattacker.

action.name: Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} för att träffa, räckvidd 1,5 m, ett mål. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) snittskada.

action.name: Light Machine Gun
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} för att träffa, räckvidd 100/400 fot, ett mål. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) genomträngande skada. Det här vapnet har den automatiska egenskapen.

Dessa mobbare, som är fotfolk i organiserade brottsgrupper, är vanligtvis lokala skurkar som är upphaussade. Efter att ha fått sin första riktiga smak av pengar och makt låter många dem gå upp i huvudet på dem. De hittar ofta skäl att bli våldsamma för minsta lilla förseelse och använder det som en ursäkt för att visa upp sin grupps muskler.

På många sätt är de inte bättre än de gangsters de var innan de rekryterades. Å andra sidan vet en bra gangster när han ska hålla huvudet lågt i närheten av capos och chefen, som inte visar någon nåd mot underordnade som inte följer order. De dåliga gangstrarna sover med fiskarna.

trait.name: Smooth Step
entries: Kaptenen kan utföra åtgärden "Avskärma sig" som en bonusåtgärd vid varje tur.

trait.name: Threaten
entries: Som en bonusåtgärd kan capo försöka skrämma en varelse som den kan se inom 30 fot från sig själv. Varelsen måste lyckas med ett {@dc 14} visdomssparande kast eller bli {@condition frightened} tills slutet av capoens nästa tur.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Capo gör två vapenattacker.

action.name: Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} för att träffa, räckvidd 1,5 m, ett mål. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) snittskada.

action.name: Magnum
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} för att träffa, räckvidd 70/280 fot, ett mål. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) genomträngande skada. Det här vapnet har den automatiska egenskapen.

reaction.name: Goad Accomplice
entries: När en allierad inom 30 fot från maffian träffar en varelse kan kaptenen tränga sig på den allierade, vilket gör att attacken ger 7 ({@damage 2d6}) extra skada.

Den regionala chefens assistent, maffians capo, ansvarar för att hålla ordning på de vanligaste. De har visat sig vara mer kompetenta än den genomsnittliga gruntjänaren och har vanligtvis en liten förtroendecirkel med den lokala chefen.

monster.name: Phase Ice
languages: understands the languages of its creators

trait.name: Digital Ghost
entries: ICE kan röra sig genom andra varelser och föremål som om de vore svår terräng. Den tar 5 ({@damage 1d10}) kraftskador om den avslutar sin tur inuti ett objekt. ICE:n är {@condition invisible} för dem som inte har AR-syn.

trait.name: Netborn
entries: ICE finns normalt på sin hemmaskin eller sitt nätverk. ICE:n kan använda halva sin rörelsehastighet för att lämna eller gå in i sin hemmamaskins eller nätverks port. När ICE:n befinner sig i sin hemmamaskin eller sitt nätverk kan den omedelbart resa till vilken port som helst som är ansluten till dess hemmamaskin eller nätverk i sin tur. Om ICE:n tillbringar sammanlagt 10 minuter utanför sin hemmamaskin eller sitt nätverk utan att vila i minst 1 minut i sin hemmamaskin eller sitt nätverk dör den.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: ICE gör två Static Discharge-attacker.

action.name: Static Discharge
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} för att träffa, når 15 fot, ett mål. {@h}18 ({@damage 4d6 + 4}) blixtskada. Om målet är en varelse som är ansluten till ett nätverk måste den lyckas med ett {@dc 15} räddningskast i intelligens eller kopplas bort från nätverket. Varelsen kan drabbas av dumpshock i processen.

action.name: Hijack Flesh {@recharge}
entries: Medan ICE:n befinner sig i sin hemmamaskin eller sitt nätverk kan den försöka besitta en varelse som är ansluten till sin hemmamaskin eller sitt nätverk med sin datajack.
Varelsen måste lyckas med ett {@dc 15} Charisma-sparkast eller bli besatt av ICE:n. ICE:n försvinner då, och målet blir {@condition incapacitated} och förlorar kontrollen över sin kropp.

ICE kontrollerar nu kroppen men berövar inte målet medvetandet. ICE:n kan inte bli måltavla för någon attack, besvärjelse eller annan effekt, och den behåller sin inriktning, intelligens, visdom, karisma och immunitet mot att bli {@condition charmed} och {@condition frightened}. Den använder i övrigt det besatta målets statistik, men får inte tillgång till målets kunskap, klassegenskaper eller färdigheter.
Besittningen varar tills kroppen sjunker till 0 träffpunkter, ICE avslutar den som en bonusåtgärd, eller tills ICE vänds eller tvingas bort av en effekt som dispel evil and good-besvärjelsen.

När besattheten upphör, återkommer ICE:n i ett obebott utrymme inom 5 fot från kroppen. Målet är immunt mot denna ICE:s Hijack Flesh i 24 timmar efter att ha lyckats med räddningskastet eller efter att besittningen upphör.

Fas ICE är en särskilt utformad form av säkerhetsåtgärd. Den är utformad genom en blandning av magi och programmering, och krafter från dataplanet dras fram för att bilda denna kännande, lydiga försvarare.

{@bold Dual Natured.} Denna varelse kan röra sig fram och tillbaka mellan nätverk och maskiner lika enkelt som en person kan glida in i eller ut ur en vattenpöl. När ICE går in i en person genom dennes datajack kan den kapa deras processer genom att ta kontroll över deras psyke och böja det så att det uppfyller orderna från dem som skapade ICE.

trait.name: Surprise Attack
entries: Om tjuvjägaren överraskar en varelse och träffar den med en attack under den första stridsrundan tar målet 7 ({@damage 2d6}) extra skada av attacken.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Tjuvjägaren gör två vapenattacker.

action.name: Bayonet
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} för att träffa, räckvidd 1,5 m, ett mål. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) genomträngande skada. Det här vapnet är fäst på tjuvjägarens jaktgevär.

action.name: Hunting Rifle
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} för att träffa, räckvidd 50/200 fot, ett mål. {@h}7 ({@damage 3d4}) genomträngande skada.

reaction.name: Hamstring
entries: När en närkampsattack missar tjuvjägaren kan den göra en närkampsattack mot den som orsakade attacken som en reaktion. Om attacken träffar reduceras målets rörelsehastighet med 10 fram till slutet av nästa tur. Tjuvjägaren kan sedan röra sig med halva sin hastighet utan att ta emot tillfälliga attacker.

Även efter att världen har blivit skövlad av megaföretag i vinstsyfte är de få naturområden som finns kvar knappast skyddade från exploatering. När allt kommer omkring finns det fortfarande alltför många vackra exemplar av faunan där ute som ännu inte har förvandlats till afrodisiakum och smaklös inredning.

{@bold Adept Hunter.} Tjuvjägaren är skicklig på att spåra upp och döda eller lemlästa magnifika djur, samtidigt som han undviker vakter. Vissa använder sig av drönarpackningar som jakthundar för att sniffa upp eller driva ut sitt byte. Några få har till och med börjat eskortera rika VIP:er på jaktresor så att de bortskämda ungarna kan leva ut sina storviltjägardrömmar.
Efter att så länge ha blivit utsatta för föroreningar och utarmning av naturresurser borde de naturligtvis inte bli förvånade när naturen slår tillbaka.

trait.name: Freeze
entries: Som en bonusåtgärd försöker detektiven skrämma en varelse som den kan se inom en radie på 30 fot. Varelsen måste lyckas med ett {@dc 14} Visdomssparkast eller bli {@condition frightened} tills slutet av detektivens nästa tur. Medan {@condition frightened} på det här sättet sjunker varelsens hastighet till 0 och den kan inte ta reaktioner.

trait.name: Hard Boiled
entries: Detektiven har fördel på räddningskast mot att vara {@condition charmed} eller {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Vigilant
entries: Varelser som befinner sig inom detektivens räckvidd provocerar fram tillfälliga attacker även om de har vidtagit åtgärden "Disengage".
När en varelse träffas av detektivens tillfälliga attack sjunker dess hastighet till 0.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Detektiven kan använda sin Mark Suspect. Den gör sedan två vapenattacker.

action.name: Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} för att träffa, räckvidd 1,5 m, ett mål. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) snittskada.

action.name: Magnum
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} för att träffa, räckvidd 70/280 fot, ett mål. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d8}) genomträngande skada och 2 ({@damage 1d4}) köldskador.

action.name: Mark Suspect (3/Day)
entries: Detektiven markerar en varelse som den kan se inom 90 fot. Under 24 timmar orsakar detektiven extra {@damage 3d6} skada på målet närhelst den träffar det med en vapenattack, och den har fördel på alla förmågekontroller som den gör för att hitta eller spåra det. Varelser som är märkta av detektiven har nackdel på Charisma (bedrägeri)-kontroller mot detektiven. Endast en varelse kan märkas på detta sätt åt gången, och att märka en andra varelse avslutar den första märkningen.

reaction.name: Read Motive
entries: När detektiven träffas av en attack från en varelse som påverkas av detektivens Mark Suspect, kan det leda till att attacken missas istället.
Detektiven spionerar på brottslingar och mördare med orubblig beslutsamhet. När en mördare är på fri fot vill du ha den här hårdkokta killen i rockärmen.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: Officeren har fördel på en attackkast mot en varelse om minst en av officerens allierade befinner sig inom 1,5 meter från varelsen och den allierade inte är det {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Polisen gör två vapenattacker.

action.name: Combat Shotgun
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 60/180 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 5d4}) piercing damage. This weapon has the scatter property.

action.name: Magnum
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} för att träffa, räckvidd 70/280 fot, ett mål. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d8}) genomträngande skada.

action.name: Shock Baton
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) lightning damage. A creature reduced to 0 hit points by this weapon falls {@condition unconscious} and is stable.

From traffic cops to desk jockeys, many police officers are just trying to get by in a shitty day job that they hate. It's sometimes easy to dehumanize the cops into faceless law enforcement, but they are each real people with families, fears, dreams, and back pain.
That said, a lot of real people are shitheads too, and cops are no different.
{@bold Sergeants.} The front line supervisors of the police force. It is the player character's sworn duty to create as much paperwork as possible for them.

trait.name: Got Your Back
entries: Creatures of the sergeants's choice within 30 feet of the sergeant have half cover so long as the sergeant can see or hear them. The sergeant also gains this benefit if there is at least one ally within range.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The sergeant has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the sergeant's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The sergeant makes two weapon attacks.

action.name: Combat Shotgun
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 60/180 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 5d4 + 4}) piercing damage.
This weapon has the scatter property.

action.name: Magnum
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 70/280 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shock Baton
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) lightning damage. A creature reduced to 0 hit points by this weapon falls {@condition unconscious} and is stable.

From traffic cops to desk jockeys, many police officers are just trying to get by in a shitty day job that they hate. It's sometimes easy to dehumanize the cops into faceless law enforcement, but they are each real people with families, fears, dreams, and back pain.
That said, a lot of real people are shitheads too, and cops are no different.
{@bold Sergeants.} The front line supervisors of the police force. It is the player character's sworn duty to create as much paperwork as possible for them.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the bruiser hits with it (included in the attack).

trait.name: Gas Masked
entries: The bruiser is immune to inhaled toxins, diseases, and poisons and has disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks while wearing the mask.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bruiser makes three weapon attacks.

action.name: Shock Baton
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) lightning damage. A creature reduced to 0 hit points by this weapon falls {@condition unconscious} and is stable.

action.name: Shield Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d4 + 5}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Magnum
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 70/280 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d8}) bludgeoning damage. This weapon uses gel bullets.

Whether it's a hostage situation or a target that poses a high threat to police, the SWAT teams are called in when standard law enforcement personnel aren't up to the task. These specially trained officers usually come prepared with RC drones for scouting, det cable for doors, and tear gas to flush out targets.

trait.name: Gas Masked
entries: The officer is immune to inhaled toxins, diseases, and poisons and has disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks while wearing the mask.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Polisen gör två vapenattacker.

action.name: Shock Baton
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) lightning damage. A creature reduced to 0 hit points by this weapon falls {@condition unconscious} and is stable.

action.name: Light Machine Gun
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. This weapon has the automatic property and uses gel bullets.

action.name: Tear Gas (1/Day)
entries: The officer throws a tear gas canister to a point within 60 feet of it, creating a 20-foot-radius sphere of yellow, nauseating gas centered at the point for 1 minute.

The cloud spreads around corners, and its area is heavily obscured. Each creature that is completely within the cloud at the start of its turn must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw against poison. On a failed save, the creature spends its action that turn retching and reeling. Creatures that are immune to being {@condition poisoned} automatically succeed on this saving throw.

Whether it's a hostage situation or a target that poses a high threat to police, the SWAT teams are called in when standard law enforcement personnel aren't up to the task. These specially trained officers usually come prepared with RC drones for scouting, det cable for doors, and tear gas to flush out targets.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The icon is an 17th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 18}, {@hit 10} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following bard spells prepared:

trait.name: Cult of Personality
entries: Creatures of the icon's choice within 30 feet of it have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects, and when an affected creature succeeds on a saving throw made against a spell or magical effect that allows it to make a saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw.

trait.name: Inspire
entries: As a bonus action, the icon can inspire another creature that can see or hear the icon, so long as the icon is aware of the creature. The inspired creature can gain advantage on one ability check, attack roll, or saving throw it makes in the next 10 minutes. A creature cannot be inspired again if it is already inspired.

action.name: Pistol
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 9} to hit, range 70/280 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 2d4}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Charming Demeanor
entries: When a creature the icon can see within 60 feet of it makes a weapon attack against the icon, the creature must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} until the end of the icon's next turn. If the creature fails the saving throw, the creature must choose a new target or lose the attack.
The pop icon is more than just a musician, more than just a celebrity. They are a zeitgeist, a force of personality that shapes society's perception of the world.

Being at the nexus of such a potent level of attention is not dissimilar from being fully submerged in a well of power. The pop icon is capable of reality defying feats of performance, so fantastic that their ridiculously over the top music videos required minimal editing and CGI.

{@bold Dark Secret.} Pop icons could not have risen to their heights without an entire crypt's worth of skeletons in their closet. While not quite a phylactery, the discovery and broadcasting of their deep secrets could result in the pop icon being canceled, stripping them of their station and power.

trait.name: Gas Masked
entries: The pyromaniac is immune to inhaled toxins, diseases, and poisons and has disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks while wearing the mask.

trait.name: Smokesight
entries: The pyromaniac can see normally through smoke, fog, and other obscuring clouds to a distance of 240 feet.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The pyromaniac can use its Napalm Grenade. It then makes two weapon attacks.

action.name: Fire Axe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d12 + 4}) slashing damage. A target hit by this attack begins burning for 1 minute, so long as it is not already burning from a flamethrower or fire axe attack, and takes 4 ({@damage 1d8}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

action.name: Flamethrower
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) fire damage. A target hit by this attack begins burning for 1 minute, so long as it is not already burning from a flamethrower or fire axe attack, and takes 4 ({@damage 1d8}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

action.name: Napalm Grenade (2/Day)
entries: The pyromaniac throws a grenade at a point within 60 feet of it. Each target in a 10- foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw. A target takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) fire damage on a failed save and begins burning for 1 minute, taking 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and is not burning.

reaction.name: Smokescreen
entries: When the pyromaniac is hit by an attack, it can create a 10-foot-radius sphere of smoke centered on itself until the end of its next turn. The sphere spreads around corners, and its area is heavily obscured. A wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses it.
"Smell that? Smoke? No, no, my friend, it's so much more than that. What you're smelling is the blend of civilization that once made this house a home.

"The wooden walls and floors supported this space where parents raised rebellious children for years, silent witnesses to the family they sheltered, now a lovely pine scent. Old furniture, dirty, torn apart again and again by the cat, but too expensive to replace, now a synthetic mix of toxic black fumes. A pleasant whiff of baking soy and boiling orange juice from the fridge, now an oven being baked in this inferno.

"Burnt hair and the savory scent of searing meat... well, it could just be the rats cooking in the walls. Or maybe the place wasn't as abandoned as we thought. It's for the best, I'd hate for this house to burn alone. Even as ashes, a place like this deserves to be a home."

The pyromaniac is a person who has given themself over to the cleansing power of flame. Wielding a flamethrower with wild abandon, their faces covered with a gas mask, and framed by the blazing timbers of a burning building, they can appear like a demon.

But that's an unfair characterization. Instead, consider them as flame enthusiasts, or fire's biggest fan. Sure, like any fandom, they can be a little annoying when they bring it into every conversation, especially when they bring literal fire.

trait.name: Smokesight
entries: The pyromaniac can see normally through smoke, fog, and other obscuring clouds to a distance of 120 feet.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The pyromaniac can use its Napalm Grenade. It then makes two weapon attacks.

trait.name: Backdraft
entries: When the inferno is reduced to 0 hit points, it explodes. Targets within 30 feet of the inferno must succeed on a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw, taking 21 ({@damage 6d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Gas Masked
entries: The inferno is immune to inhaled toxins, diseases, and poisons and has disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks while wearing the mask.

trait.name: Immolated
entries: As a bonus action, the inferno douses itself in fuel and lights itself on fire. When a creature or vehicle starts its turn within 5 feet of the inferno while it is on fire, it takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage. A creature or vehicle that touches the inferno or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage. The fire is extinguished if a gallon of water is splashed on the inferno, or if an effect would extinguish flames in the inferno's space.

trait.name: Smokesight
entries: The inferno can see normally through smoke, fog, and other obscuring clouds to a distance of 1 mile.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The inferno can use its Napalm Grenade. It then makes three weapon attacks.

action.name: Burning Chainsaw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

This weapon has the automatic property. A target hit by this attack begins burning for 1 minute, so long as it is not already burning from a flamethrower or burning chainsaw attack, and takes 4 ({@damage 1d8}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

action.name: Flamethrower
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 11} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) fire damage. A target hit by this attack begins burning for 1 minute, so long as it is not already burning from a flamethrower or fire axe attack, and takes 4 ({@damage 1d8}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

But that's an unfair characterization. Instead, consider them as flame enthusiasts, or fire's biggest fan. Sure, like any fandom, they can be a little annoying when they bring it into every conversation, especially when they bring literal fire.

{@bold Walking Inferno.} This pyromaniac has ascended beyond simply being crazy about fire, it has infused their essence, their soul. The walking inferno doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep. However, they must consume two pounds of fuel (gasoline, coal, or wood) each day or they gain one level of exhaustion.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The ooze can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Glowing
entries: The ooze sheds dim light in a 10-foot radius.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage and 14 ({@damage 4d6}) radiant damage. A creature hit by this attack must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or gain one level of irradiated.

reaction.name: Unstable Split
entries: When the ooze takes 15 or more damage of any type except psychic damage in a single turn, it can create a clone of itself. The cloned ooze has only 10 hit points, and when it is reduced to 0 hit points, it explodes. Targets within 10 feet of the cloned ooze must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or take 7 ({@dice 2d6}) radiant and 7 ({@damage 2d6}) thunder damage. If the clone is still alive after 1 minute, it reduces its own hit points to 0.
Let this serve as a reminder to everyone to clean out their fridge on a regular basis.

The radioactive ooze is a mutation of nuclear waste in a quasi-sentient lifeform. The events necessary for this transformation to be triggered is better left to the eggheads, what you need to know is that there's a glowing slime that's probably not super great for your health to be around.

{@bold Unstable.} When the radioactive ooze is affected by sudden force or trauma, the ooze will reflexively cause its own atoms to split. This process creates an explosively unstable clone of itself, whose brief but exciting life is doomed to come to an unfortunate end.

{@bold Hunger.} The ooze is a short-lived specimen due to its instability, and will instinctively search out live food and other sources of energy to prolong itself. This makes it more energetic and aggressive than most of its ooze brethren.

trait.name: Contaminate (1/Turn)
entries: When the hydra hits a creature with a melee weapon attack, it can force the target to make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target gains one level of irradiated, to a maximum of level 5.

trait.name: Fallout
entries: When another creature spends a total of 1 hour within 30 feet of the hydra, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or gain 1 level of irradiated, to a maximum of level 5.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The hydra can hold its breath for 1 hour.

trait.name: Multiple Heads
entries: The hydra has five heads. While it has more than one head, the hydra has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition blinded}, {@condition charmed}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition stunned}, and knocked {@condition unconscious}.
Whenever the hydra takes 25 or more damage in a single turn, one of its heads dies. If all its heads die, the hydra dies.

At the end of its turn, it grows two heads for each of its heads that died since its last turn, unless it has taken fire damage since its last turn. The hydra regains 10 hit points for each head regrown in this way.

trait.name: Reactive Heads
entries: For each head the hydra has beyond one, it gets an extra Reaction that can be used only for Opportunity Attacks.

trait.name: Wakeful
entries: While the hydra sleeps, at least one of its heads is awake.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hydra makes as many bite attacks as it has heads.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) piercing damage.

monster.name: Radioactive Zombie
languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Contaminate (1/Turn)
entries: When the hydra hits a creature with a melee weapon attack, it can force the target to make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target gains one level of irradiated, to a maximum of level 5.

trait.name: Fallout
entries: When another creature spends a total of 1 hour within 30 feet of the hydra, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or gain 1 level of irradiated, to a maximum of level 5.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the razorgirl is subjected to an effect that allows her to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half the damage, the razorgirl instead takes no damage if she succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if she fails.

trait.name: Hidden Blades
entries: The razorgirl's cyberclaws are hidden inside her hands until she draws them.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The razorgirl makes three melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

action.name: Cyberclaws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) slashing damage and 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage. If the razorgirl rolls a 20 on a melee attack with the claws, she can make one additional melee weapon attack against the target.

action.name: Magnum
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 70/280 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Hydraulic Kick
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
entries: The razorgirl halves the damage that she takes from an attack that hits her. The razorgirl must be able to see the attacker.

reaction.name: Hydraulic Landing (Recharges on a Short or Long Rest)
entries: When the razorgirl falls, she reduces the damage from the fall to 0 and can make a hydraulic kick attack against a creature within 5 feet of her. If the attack hits, it deals its normal damage plus {@dice 1d6} for every 10 feet the razorgirl fell.

The threat isn't immediately apparent. Aside from the pistol bulge from the holster just barely visible under her puffy jacket, you don't see any weapons. She isn't even reaching for it as she smoothly stalks forward toward you. Still, she looks tense, like a cat ready to pounce. How adorable.
"Hey, baby, maybe you should run along home before you get yourself hurt-" is all you can get out before you feel sharp razorblades at your throat.

{@bold Stepping Razor.} Razorgirls are heavily modified killers built for swift combat. Able to climb and move quickly, they are at their best when leaping from above to pounce on an unwary opponent. Their enhanced reflexes give them an edge, as if they needed it on top of their general edginess.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the razorgirl is subjected to an effect that allows her to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half the damage, the razorgirl instead takes no damage if she succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if she fails.

trait.name: Hidden Blades
entries: The razorgirl's cyberclaws are hidden inside her hands until she draws them.

trait.name: Spiked Heels
entries: Difficult terrain doesn't cost the razogirl extra movement and she can move up, down, and across vertical surfaces and upside down along ceilings, while leaving her hands free.

trait.name: Wired Reflexes
entries: The razorgirl can take two reactions, instead of one. When she does so, she can't take another

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The razorgirl makes three attacks.

action.name: Cyberclaws

trait.name: Sense-Log
entries: The reporter can record what it sees, hears, and feels, and offload the recorded data to machines through its datajack port or wirelessly.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The reporter makes two weapon attacks.

action.name: Stun Gun
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) lightning damage.

action.name: Pistol
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 70/280 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 2d4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Pepper Spray (2/Day)
entries: The reporter sprays a can of stinging fluid at a creature up to 10 feet away. The target must succeed on a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} for 3 rounds. At the end of each of its turns, the target can repeat the saving throw. On a successful save, the blindness ends.

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
entries: The reporter halves the damage that it takes from an attack that hits it. The reporter must be able to see the attacker.

The world is filled to the breaking point with corrupt politicians, greedy and heartless corporations, and people struggling to survive. In a society constantly vying to bring your attention to the latest hot trend or spicy gossip, these stories are lost to the whirlwind.

The only hope of shedding light on the injustices of the world comes from that most noble of informer: the reporter. Focused on getting the biggest scoop yet, the reporter is the last bastion of investigative journalism.

{@bold Multifaceted.} Or, more accurately, the game-streaming reporter, or celebrity reporter, or erotic reporter. After all, nobody will tune in to watch a reporter consistently for the occasional news bomb. That's a lot of dead air, and the viewers, with their goldfish memories, will forget someone exists if they aren't consistently relevant in their lives. Supplementing their reporting with additional revenue is necessary if the reporter wants to be able to consistently afford things like rent and food.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The rocker is a 4th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following bard spells prepared:

trait.name: Radical Shout
entries: The rocker can use a bonus action to shout at one creature within 30 feet of it. The creature must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be pushed 10 feet away and become {@condition frightened} of the rocker until the end of the rocker's next turn.

action.name: Combat Knife
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Submachine Gun
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 50/200 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d6}) piercing damage. This weapon has the automatic and burst-fire properties.

It's not easy job, getting on stage and rocking your heart out. It's not easy to rail against the man and everything He stands for. It's not easy to wade through a sea of drugs and horny groupies. No, it's not an easy job, but someone has to do it.

People say you should probably have stopped touring decades ago, but that's bullshit. You're reaching new peaks, your music has finally hit its stride again, and you really hav e to pay off that mountain of debt somehow.

{@bold Merchandiser.} The rocker is an iconic punk who uses music to communicate their discontent with the establishment, and also to sell as many albums and t-shirts as possible. What do you mean nobody uses vinyl anymore, and hasn't for a century?

trait.name: Guided Missiles
entries: When the rocketman attacks with its rocket launcher, it can choose a point it can see within 120 feet of it, and fire a rocket at that point. When the rocket arrives, the rocketman momentarily gains sight from its location. Immediately after, the rocketman can redirect the rocket to make a rocket launcher attack against a target the rocketman can see within 120 feet of the rocket's location.
The rocketman does not have advantage on the attack roll due to the target not being able to see it.

trait.name: Integrated Weapons
entries: The rocketman's weapons are integrated into its body, and are concealed when not drawn.
The rocketman cannot be disarmed of its weapons, but its weapons can be destroyed or disabled.

trait.name: Internal Factory
entries: The rocketman's body is designed to produce and load rockets, allowing the rocketman to reload its rocket launcher (no action required). If the rocketman is hit by a critical hit, it explodes, forcing targets within 20 feet of it (rocketman included) to make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) thunder damage, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The rocketman makes two weapon attacks.

action.name: Rocket Butt
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Rocket Launcher
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 120/480 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage and 7 ({@damage 2d6}) thunder damage. This weapon has the blast property.
Burning out his fuse up here alone...
It takes some real guts to attach so much rocket fuel and explosive material to your body. Or maybe a thorough lack of risk analysis and self reflection.

The rocketman is a beautiful combination of aerospace engineering and cybernetic alterations. Jets are integrated into the rocketman's body, along with cooling ducts to allow for air flow to deal with the tremendous amount of heat the body is putting out. More incredible still, the body houses an internal warehouse for rocket casings and explosive material. This means that the rocketman's integrated rocket launcher is never wanting for ammunition, since the body can produce rockets faster than the launcher can fire them.

{@bold Firework.} Of course, storing too many internal compartments of explosives is dangerous business. A lucky hit could cause one of the compartments to rupture and blast a hole in the side of the rocketman. Still, no guts, no glory, right?
Alright, it's definitely a lack of risk analysis.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The rockstar is an 8th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following bard spells prepared:

trait.name: Rebellious Aura
entries: Creatures of the rocker's choice within 30 feet of it have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Riot
entries: The rockstar can use a bonus action to choose up to three creatures that it can see within 90 feet of it. Each creature must use its reaction to make one weapon attack against a target of the rockstar's choice. If the creature is unwilling, it must make a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw. On a successful save, the creature is unaffected.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The rockstar makes two weapon attacks.

action.name: Combat Knife
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Assault Rifle
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} för att träffa, räckvidd 100/400 fot, ett mål. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d6}) genomträngande skada. Det här vapnet har egenskaperna automatisk och burst-fire.

The fog begins rolling forth, cascading over the stage. The spotlights swirl, searching through the fog. Eventually they converge, finding a lone silhouette, shadowy against the backlit fog. The fog begins to curl away, revealing the rockstar, their stunning pink mohawk and spiked black leather jacket proudly on display.

It's then that the opening notes begin to play as the rest of the band emerges from the fog with their instruments in hand. The rockstar steps up to microphone, filling their lungs and ready to unleash hell.
The crowd goes wild.

{@bold Shining Star.} The rockstar is a force of nature, a being of music and energy that defies societal norms. Where other norm-breakers are shunned, the rockstar finds acceptance among their audience for the audacity of their message.

{@bold Tempest.} The rockstar exists in the eye of the storm of sex, drugs, and drama. It's expected that over the course of a rockstar's career, they will break up their band over an argument, descend into addiction, rise up from rock bottom, regather the band, and then go on a whirlwind reunion tour. From there, it's rinse and repeat.

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the samurai can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

trait.name: Internal Battery (2/Day)
entries: When the samurai hits a creature with a melee attack, it can deal an additional 10 ({@damage 3d6}) lightning damage. If the samurai takes lightning damage, it regains a use of this ability.

trait.name: Unsheathe
entries: The first time the samurai draws its weapons in combat, it has advantage on melee weapon attacks until the end of its turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The samurai makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Dual Katanas
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) slashing damage. This attack deals half damage if only a single katana is used.

action.name: Reflected Missile
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 40/120 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) piercing damage.
This attack can only be taken as part of the reflect missile

reaction.name: Reflect Missile
entries: When this creature is hit by a ranged weapon, it can reduce the damage by {@dice 4d10}. If this reduces the damage to 0, this creature can immediately make a reflected missile attack.

Street bushido is a proud tradition amongst the samurai who practice it. It consists of a number of codes, practices, and philosophies. Such codes include the art of self-discipline, rules for honorable duels, showing respect to allies and enemies alike, not having loud conversations on your smart phone in public, and not blocking, like, the whole fucking aisle with your cart in a grocery store.

{@bold Proud Lineage.} The heritage of street bushido stretches back for generations, and has created its own subculture of diligent street samurai. They each follow the codes as a way of life, keeping in line those samurai who bring dishonor on themselves.
All this is to say that street bushido is a very real thing, and definitely not completely made up.

trait.name: Honorable Duel (2/Day)

The target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be under the effect of the compelled duel spell for 1 minute. A creature can willingly fail this save, and the spell does not require the samurai's concentration.

entries: When other creatures of the captain's choice within 30 feet of the captain make an attack roll or a saving throw, the creature can roll a {@dice d4} and add the number to the attack roll or saving throw. The creature must be able to see or hear the captain to gain this benefit.

trait.name: Explosive (1/Day)
entries: Roll a {@dice d6} to see what explosive the captain has. On a 1, 2, or 3, it's a tier 1 fragmentation grenade. On a 4 or 5, it's a tier 1 flashbang. On a 6, it's a smoke grenade.

The well-trained and armed elite security forces are a different matter. Having survived numerous deadly ordeals in the lower ranks of security, these competent individuals have distinguished themselves from the expendable herd and been promoted into the upper echelons of security.

These elites are trusted and loyal employees, placed into positions guarding a corporation's most critical assets. Typically, teams of elite security forces are assigned to guard members of the board of executives, top secret facilities, and other targets the corporation deems essential to its own survival.

trait.name: Chameleon Skin
entries: As an action, the sniper can turn {@condition invisible}. The invisibility ends if the sniper attacks, or if it takes damage.

trait.name: Marksman
entries: The sniper does not have disadvantage on ranged weapon attack rolls while {@condition prone}, and its ranged weapon attacks ignore half cover and three-quarters cover.

trait.name: Steady Aim (1/Turn)
entries: The sniper can deal an extra 21 ({@damage 6d6}) damage when it hits a target with a ranged weapon attack.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The sniper makes two weapon attacks.

action.name: Combat Knife
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d4 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Sniper Rifle
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 200/800 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) piercing damage and 2 ({@damage 1d4}) lightning damage. This weapon has the scoped property.

action.name: Overwatch
entries: The sniper locks down a section of the battlefield with suppressing fire. Define a 20-foot cube within sight of the sniper. When a target the sniper can see enters or moves within the area for the first time on a turn, the sniper can make a ranged weapon attack against it with a firearm, so long as it is in range.

Precision is the key. So many people wander through their lives in a sleep-deprived, drug-addled haze. They get up, miss numerous patches when shaving, sloppily weave through traffic on the way to work, meander aimlessly through their day, miss their highway exit on the way home, and fall asleep, same as the day before. Hell, they probably can't even piss straight.

{@bold Professionals.} The way of the sniper is more elegant, a refined approach to murder that is cleaner and less personal, and unlikely to result in a dry cleaning bill for bloodstains. Life is far more manageable when you view everything through a scope, almost like watching a nature documentary.

{@bold Deadeye.} Not all snipers are created equal, it takes a combination of talented, steady hands, and a cool disposition to make a good sniper. The best snipers in the world can fire a shot that guides a bullet through a plate glass window, between a stripper's cybernetically enhanced, wobbling breasts, and straight into the forehead of the VIP.
Don't take my word for it, there are anime documentaries about the whole thing.

trait.name: Chameleon Skin v2
entries: As a bonus action, the sniper can turn {@condition invisible}. The invisibility ends if the sniper takes damage.

trait.name: Headshot
entries: Any hit the sniper scores against a surprised creature is a critical hit.

trait.name: Marksman
entries: The sniper does not have disadvantage on ranged weapon attack rolls while {@condition prone}, and its ranged weapon attacks ignore half cover and three-quarters cover.

trait.name: Steady Aim (1/Turn)
entries: The sniper can deal an extra 28 ({@damage 8d6}) damage when it hits a target with a ranged weapon attack.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The sniper makes two weapon attacks.

action.name: Combat Knife
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d4 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Sniper Rifle
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 10} to hit, range 200/800 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) piercing damage and 2 ({@damage 1d4}) lightning damage. This weapon has the scoped property.

action.name: Overwatch
entries: The sniper locks down a section of the battlefield with suppressing fire. Define a 20-foot cube within sight of the sniper. When a target the sniper can see enters or moves within the area for the first time on a turn, the sniper can make a ranged weapon attack against it with a firearm, so long as it is in range.

Precision is the key. So many people wander through their lives in a sleep-deprived, drug-addled haze. They get up, miss numerous patches when shaving, sloppily weave through traffic on the way to work, meander aimlessly through their day, miss their highway exit on the way home, and fall asleep, same as the day before. Hell, they probably can't even piss straight.

{@bold Professionals.} The way of the sniper is more elegant, a refined approach to murder that is cleaner and less personal, and unlikely to result in a dry cleaning bill for bloodstains. Life is far more manageable when you view everything through a scope, almost like watching a nature documentary.

{@bold Deadeye.} Not all snipers are created equal, it takes a combination of talented, steady hands, and a cool disposition to make a good sniper. The best snipers in the world can fire a shot that guides a bullet through a plate glass window, between a stripper's cybernetically enhanced, wobbling breasts, and straight into the forehead of the VIP.
Don't take my word for it, there are anime documentaries about the whole thing.

trait.name: Marksman
entries: The sniper does not have disadvantage on ranged weapon attack rolls while {@condition prone}, and its ranged weapon attacks ignore half cover and three-quarters cover.

trait.name: Steady Aim (1/Turn)
entries: The sniper can deal an extra 14 ({@damage 4d6}) damage when it hits a target with a ranged weapon attack.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The sniper makes two weapon attacks.

action.name: Combat Knife
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Sniper Rifle
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 200/800 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d10}) piercing damage. This weapon has the scoped property.

action.name: Overwatch
entries: The sniper locks down a section of the battlefield with suppressing fire. Define a 20-foot cube within sight of the sniper. When a target the sniper can see enters or moves within the area for the first time on a turn, the sniper can make a ranged weapon attack against it with a firearm, so long as it is in range.

Precision is the key. So many people wander through their lives in a sleep-deprived, drug-addled haze. They get up, miss numerous patches when shaving, sloppily weave through traffic on the way to work, meander aimlessly through their day, miss their highway exit on the way home, and fall asleep, same as the day before. Hell, they probably can't even piss straight.

{@bold Professionals.} The way of the sniper is more elegant, a refined approach to murder that is cleaner and less personal, and unlikely to result in a dry cleaning bill for bloodstains. Life is far more manageable when you view everything through a scope, almost like watching a nature documentary.

{@bold Deadeye.} Not all snipers are created equal, it takes a combination of talented, steady hands, and a cool disposition to make a good sniper. The best snipers in the world can fire a shot that guides a bullet through a plate glass window, between a stripper's cybernetically enhanced, wobbling breasts, and straight into the forehead of the VIP.
Don't take my word for it, there are anime documentaries about the whole thing.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The punk makes two attacks with its heavy chain or machine pistol, or one bola attack.

action.name: Heavy Chain
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Machine Pistol
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 50/200 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 2d4}) piercing damage. This weapon has the automatic property.

action.name: Bola
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 40/120 ft., one Large or smaller creature. {@h}The target is {@condition restrained}. A creature can use its action to make a {@dc 10} Strength check to free itself or another creature in a bola, ending the effect on a success. Dealing 5 slashing damage to the bola (AC 10) frees the target without harming it and destroys the bola.

The roar of the motorcycles drowns out any other noise as gangs of these biker punks race down the street. Armed with an automatic pistol and heavy chains, these hooting and hollering gangs have abandoned all sense of self preservation for the thrill of speed and blood.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The bully has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the bully's allies is within 5 ft. of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Rusty Pipe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Pistol
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, range 70/280 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 2d4}) piercing damage.
These thugs might be the alpha dogs of their ramshackle hovels, but they're not bright enough to avoid trying their intimidation tactics against some cybered-up badass.

trait.name: Muse (1/Hour)
entries: The enforcer can consume muse as a bonus action, gaining 8 temporary hit points and adding {@dice 1d4} to Constitution checks and Constitution saving throws for 1 hour.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The enforcer makes two weapon attacks.

action.name: Double-Barreled Shotgun
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 60/180 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 4d4}) piercing damage. This weapon has the scatter property.

action.name: Magnum
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 70/280 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d8}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Vengeful Kick
entries: After a creature makes an attack against the enforcer within 5 feet, the creature must succeed on a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

The enforcer is the backbone of any gang big enough to need to start enforcing discipline amongst its ranks. When the average thug steps out of line, or some outsider roughs up a few of the crew, the enforcer is there to step in and brutally correct the situation.

trait.name: Muse (1/Hour)
entries: The gangster can consume muse as a bonus action, gaining 6 temporary hit points and adding {@dice 1d4} to Constitution checks and Constitution saving throws for 1 hour.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The gangster makes two weapon attacks.

action.name: Spiked Bat
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Revolver
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 70/280 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d6}) piercing damage.

The rank and file of any gang worth its salt. These gangsters bear a resemblance to peacocks in the way they show off vibrant colors with LED tattoos and flamboyant hairstyles. They dress 'stylishly' in the best threads they can buy or steal, cut to show off their drug-enhanced muscles.

trait.name: Muse (1/Hour)
entries: The boss can consume muse as a bonus action, gaining 8 temporary hit points and adding {@dice 1d4} to Constitution checks and Constitution saving throws for 1 hour.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The boss makes two weapon attacks.

action.name: Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} för att träffa, räckvidd 1,5 m, ett mål. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) snittskada.

action.name: Magnum
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 70/280 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Slippery Bastard
entries: When a creature makes an attack against the boss, the boss can move up to half its movement speed. This movement does not provoke opportunity attacks.

Whether they're leading a crew of biker punks, or a gang of street toughs, or just a very flamboyant group of armed strippers, the gangster boss is seen as the leader of the pack. In some cases, they may find their position is nothing more than middle management under the authority of the local gangster king.

trait.name: Compel Underling
entries: As a bonus action, the king commands one ally it can see within 30 feet of it. The ally gains advantage on all attacks it makes, and all attacks against the ally have advantage, until the end of the king's next turn.

trait.name: Muse (1/Hour)
entries: The boss can consume muse as a bonus action, gaining 12 temporary hit points and adding {@dice 1d4} to Constitution checks and Constitution saving throws for 1 hour.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The king makes two weapon attacks.

action.name: Sledgehammer
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Light Machine Gun
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) piercing damage. This weapon has the automatic property.

action.name: Fragmentation Grenade (3/Day)
entries: The king throws a grenade at a point within 60 feet of it. Each creature in a 10- foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) piercing damage and 7 ({@damage 2d6}) thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

reaction.name: Hell to Pay
entries: When a creature makes an attack against the boss, the creature must make a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} until the end of its next turn.

At the heights that street scum can hope to reach, the gangster king reigns as supreme despot over their kingdom. Grander in name than reality, their kingdom is usually just the turf they can scrape together, stretching only as far as the edge of the slums.

action.name: Jagged Shiv
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Pistol
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, range 70/280 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 2d4}) piercing damage.

The losers of the cyberpunk world, goons are the sycophants that latch themselves onto whatever strong personality comes along. In media, they're the background decoration that sneers and laughs at the main character during dialog exchanges between more important characters, usually in the brief moments before the goons die.

trait.name: Ride or Die
entries: The raider has advantage on checks and saving throws to avoid being pushed from its vehicle or knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The raider makes two weapon attacks.

action.name: Long Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage, or 8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) slashing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Micro SMG
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 50/200 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d6}) piercing damage. This weapon has the automatic property.

reaction.name: Last Ride
entries: When the road raider or a vehicle it is driving is reduced to 0 hit points, the road raider can have the vehicle it is driving move up to half of its speed. The vehicle then explodes as if reduced to 0 hit points.

Tough street warriors that have survived for long enough to qualify as veterans. Experienced in vehicular combat, the road raider feels most at home above the speed limit. They know that they aren't long for this world, and when their ticket is punched, they're determined not to go down without raising hell.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The street shaman is an 12th-level spellcaster.
Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following druid spells prepared:

trait.name: Wheel-Saint
entries: Vehicles the shaman is driving have advantage on ability checks and saving throws.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The shaman makes two weapon attacks.

action.name: Tire Iron
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage and 9 ({@damage 2d8}) thunder damage.

action.name: Magnum
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 70/280 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d8}) piercing damage and 9 ({@damage 2d8}) thunder damage.

action.name: Collision Course {@recharge 5}
entries: The shaman embodies the spirit of a burning motorcycle, moving up to 80 feet in a straight line, and can move through the space of any creature or vehicle, but must end this action in an empty space. If the shaman enters a creature's or vehicle's space during this movement, the target must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, the target takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) bludgeoning damage and 18 ({@damage 4d8}) fire damage.

The street shaman is an urban mystery, an enigma wrapped in shadow that defies the bright neon lights. They also smell like motor oil and exhaust fumes, no matter how many times they put their grim shrouds through the wash.

{@bold Urban Mystery.} The street shaman shares a primal connection with the city, hearing its pulse as its veins thrum with non-stop traffic. They wield strange powers, performing shamanic services that the superstitious and desperate will pay big money to acquire.

trait.name: Pilfer
entries: As a bonus action, the swarm makes a Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) check against the passive Perception of a creature within the swarm's space. On a success a tiny item is stolen and, if possible, immediately used.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny monkey. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

action.name: Monkey Bites (swarm has more than half HP)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 0 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 6d6}) piercing damage, or 10 ({@damage 3d6}) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

Captured or bred for captivity, these monkeys are kept as test subjects for all manner of dubious experiments. While scientists would love to perform these tests on humanoids, monkeys require less paperwork.

{@bold Wild Side.} Being subjected to extremely close confinement and mistreatment is enough to drive these monkeys into a wild rage, attacking and tearing apart the nearest non-monkey they see. Because of this, it's important to ensure that the containment units they are placed into do not fail under any circumstances.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The technomancer is an 13th-level spellcaster.
Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following wizard spells prepared:

trait.name: Countermeasures (1/Day)
entries: When the technomancer is reduced below half its hit points, or takes damage while below half its hit points, it can become {@condition invisible} for 1 minute.
The invisibility ends if the technomancer attacks or casts a spell.

trait.name: Sabotage
entries: As a bonus action, the technomancer chooses a creature holding a firearm or a Tiny machine it can see within 60 feet of it. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Intelligence saving throw or the next attack made with the weapon is at disadvantage. If the target is a machine, it loses all functionality. If a creature is holding the machine, it can make a {@dc 16} Intelligence saving throw to negate this effect. This ability creates a visual effect that can only be seen with AR vision.

action.name: Combat Knife
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Pulse (2/Day)
entries: The technomancer cause an EMP at a point it can see within 60 feet of it. Machines, constructs, and vehicles within 30 feet of that point are subjected to EMP.
Machines in the area cease to function for 1 minute.
Constructs in the area with the Electronics feature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or they are {@condition stunned} until the end of the technomancer's next turn.

Vehicles in the area must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or their movement speed is reduced to 0 and they can't take actions or reactions until the end of the technomancer's next turn.
Additionally, wireless and radio connections in a 100-foot- radius centered on the point are suppressed for 1 minute.

reaction.name: Firewall
entries: When an attack would hit the technomancer, it can raise a burning barrier that reduces the damage from the attack by 14 ({@dice 4d6}). If the attack was a melee attack from a creature within 10 feet of the technomancer, the creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw or take fire damage equal to the amount rolled to reduce the damage.

Whether you like it or not, technology is an inescapable part of our lives. Ask yourself, when was the last time you entered a room without a machine or gadget in it? If you, like most folks, have a smartphone in your pocket or a datajack in your head, then it's probably been a long, long time.

It's because the world is so suffused with technology that technomancers, those capable of manipulating the data stream and bending it to their will, have begun appearing. It's a special sort of magic that traverses the ocean of information, but those who wield it can gain access to a near limitless source of power.

{@bold Techminds.} The technomantic abilities begin manifesting themselves in those who have gained an intrinsic understanding of electronics and networking, having immersed themselves in learning every aspect that greases the flow of information in the modern world. When they come to learn an intrinsic truth of the nature of technology, they awaken the knowledge necessary to orchestrate every circuit, transistor, and data byte in pursuit of their goals.

{@bold Disgruntled.} So, the next time you want to curse at that poor IT worker about how your laptop stopped working after it fell in a puddle, remember to instead be kind. After all, you probably don't want to be found having mysteriously strangled yourself to death with your mouse cable.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The technomancer is an 17th-level spellcaster.
Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 18}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following wizard spells prepared:

trait.name: Active Countermeasures (1/Day)
entries: When the technomancer is reduced below half its hit points, or takes damage while below half its hit points, it can become {@condition invisible} for 1 minute.

trait.name: Devious Sabotage
entries: As a bonus action, the technomancer chooses a creature holding a firearm or a Medium or smaller machine it can see within 60 feet of it. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Intelligence saving throw or the creature makes an attack with the firearm against a creature of the technomancer's choice (no action required). If the target is a machine, it explodes, dealing 10 ({@damage 3d6}) thunder damage to creatures within 10 feet of it. If a creature is holding the machine, it can make a {@dc 18} Intelligence saving throw to negate this effect. This ability creates a visual effect that can only be seen with AR vision.

action.name: Combat Knife
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

entries: The technomancer cause an EMP at a point it can see within 60 feet of it. Machines, constructs, and vehicles within 30 feet of that point are subjected to EMP.
